author: Michelle No
title: Here's Anthony Bourdain's Trick To Making Perfect Scrambled Eggs Every Time
text:
View this image ›
littlethings.com Or at least, they think they do.
ID: 10722379 2. You just whisk up some eggs, plop them on a pan, and — Bam! Scrambled eggs, the best single-ingredient breakfast there ever was. View this image ›
Handmadepictures / Getty Images / Via gettyimages.com ID: 10722589 3. But according to chef, travel show host, and general badass Anthony Bourdain, there’s a way* to make scrambled eggs that’s better than the others. View this image ›
anthonybourdain / Via instagram.com *His way, obviously.
ID: 10722615 4. In a video interview with Tech Insider , he gave the full step-by-step: ID: 10722765 5. Start off by heating your pan — but not too much. View this image ›
youtube.com ID: 10722777 6. Crack fresh eggs on a flat surface and into a bowl. View this image ›
youtube.com Cracking eggs on a flat surface as opposed to the edge of a pan minimizes shell breakage.
ID: 10722780 7. Add salt and pepper into the mixture — but no water or any kind of cream. View this image ›
youtube.com “I just don’t feel that milk or cream adds anything,” says Bourdain. “It’s about the egg. You’re not making a quiche here, you’re making scrambled eggs.”
ID: 10722861 8. Beat eggs until you get a “ripple of white and yellow throughout.” View this image ›
youtube.com But don’t let this mixture sit — beat the eggs right before you’re about to put them in the pan .
ID: 10722796 9. Add a generous slice of butter to your hot pan and let it melt, or “foam.” View this image ›
youtube.com ID: 10722870 10. Place the eggs in the buttered pan and let them cook for a bit. View this image ›
youtube.com ID: 10722879 11. Create texture by pushing the mixture around in a figure-8 pattern. View this image ›
youtube.com But don’t try and manipulate the eggs too much, or else you’ll end up with “tiny, little bits of egg as your final product,” says Bourdain.
ID: 10722887 12. Finish cooking when you have “something fluffy, airy, rippled, with a nice textural note when you taste the egg.” View this image ›
Warner Bros. / CBS Bone app the teeth!
ID: 10722919 13. And there you have it — a guide to making the perfect scrambled eggs, and at least five new ways to describe eggs. To watch the whole video, check out the Tech Insider video below: ID: 10722957 Video available at: https://youtube.com/watch?v=sBJESSMD8qA . youtube.com ID: 10722738 How do you make your eggs? Just like this — my great-great-great-great-great grandma honestly invented this method. With some kind of dairy, like a normal person.
